About The Role
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Product Operations Analyst to join our team in London. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Heap.io or similar product usage tracking tools and be proficient in working with reporting platforms such as Databricks Dashboards, Power BI or Tableau. The role will focus on optimizing product performance, informing the product strategy, ensuring data-driven decisions, and supporting cross-functional teams with accurate and actionable insights.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Management and Analysis:
Leverage Heap.io to track, analyze, and report on product usage data and user behaviour.
Combine product usage data, financial data and engineering team data to build, maintain and automate comprehensive reports and dashboards using platforms such as Databricks Dashboards, Power BI, or similar tools.
Develop insights from large disparate database to inform product decisions and operational improvements.
Advocate for best practices in tools and instrumentation to ensure accurate, consistent and useable data.
Cross-Functional Support:
Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams to identify and prioritize operational improvements.
Translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Serve as the primary contact for product data-related inquiries and issues.
Process Optimization:
Identify opportunities to improve product workflows, user experience, and operational efficiency.
Standardize product reporting processes to ensure consistency, accuracy, and transparency across the organization.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and propose initiatives to improve product and operational performance.
Stakeholder Communication:
Provide regular updates and insights to senior management and key stakeholders on product performance.
Present findings through compelling data visualizations and clear communication.
Ensure all stakeholders have access to timely, accurate, and relevant data to support decision-making.
About You
Required Skills & Experience:
Proven experience with Heap.io for product analytics and data tracking.
Hands-on experience with reporting platforms like Databricks Dashboards, Power BI or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and interpret large datasets.
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data querying and analysis is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, handling multiple tasks and stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline.
Previous experience in a Product Operations role, or a related data/analytics role.
Familiarity with additional analytics platforms such as Fullstory, Pendo, Amplitude etc
Why You’ll Love Working with Us:
Innovative Environment: Be part of a team that values creativity and innovation.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
Collaborative Culture: Work in a supportive and collaborative environment with a diverse group of professionals.
Impactful Work: Your work will directly impact investment professionals worldwide, enhancing their user experience.
Generous Leave: 25 days annual leave (+8 bank holidays), Holiday-Flex and a gifted December break.
Volunteer Time: 4 days of volunteer leave per year to give back to your community.
Comprehensive Benefits: Life Cover, Private Medical Insurance.
Financial Perks: Employee Incentive Reward Scheme, 4.5% matches pension contribution and a Cycle to Work Scheme.
Employee Support: Employee Assistance Programme to enhance employee’s wellbeing & Referral Scheme to help reward your network.
Flexible Working: Enjoy a flexible working policy to balance your professional & person life.

About Us
Who we are:
PEI Group is a subscriber-focused business intelligence company. With our multi-talented global team of over 480 people, spread across EMEA, USA & Asia, our purpose is to inform and connect investment professionals across global, specialised markets. We identify specific high growth, high value investment sectors and themes where deep insight, strong market relationships and active capital flows are critical for success.
What we do:
PEI Group provides industry-leading journalism, data, and market insight to subscribing clients via a wide portfolio of specialist brands supported by our robust and scalable digital publishing, analytics, and database platform. We also track the firms and individuals who shape markets and bring client-communities together to enable knowledge sharing, profile building and relationship development through professional networks and events. Wherever our markets are active – in New York, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Sydney, Hong Kong, Singapore, London and elsewhere – PEI is hard at work examining crucial market forces and shifting investment themes, identifying active investors and their capital allocations, and scanning ahead for regulatory changes, new compliance requirements and other risk factors.
At PEI we value diverse talent and welcome applications from everyone – regardless of background. We are an equal opportunity employer and our inclusive culture at PEI is reflected in every stage of the recruitment journey. Please inform us at initial stages of the recruitment process if you require any reasonable adjustments and we can accommodate this.
PEI Group supports flexible working arrangements, and we welcome career returners.
